title: Witness Integration (Meta-Pattern)
description: Detects and affirms when experiential knowledge, eyewitness testimony, and local lived perspectives are actively included in monitoring, decision-making, and system design. This sensor highlights resilience practices where 'noise' is treated as early warning rather than discarded.
indicators: Community or worker reports systematically logged and reviewed alongside expert data
Indigenous or local ecological knowledge incorporated into planning and hazard detection
Post-incident analyses show witness input reduced risk or accelerated recovery
Multiple knowledge systems are formally recognized as valid sources of early-warning information
metrics: Fraction of investigations that cite local/witness contributions before vs. after incidents
Time lag between witness report and institutional response (shorter = healthier integration)
Number of policy or design adjustments triggered by firsthand reports
Diversity index of knowledge sources represented in system monitoring
